headline.main: LED IN HEATLH CARE FOR YOUNG

docs.lead_paragraph: Dr. Edward T. Wilkes, a leader in health care for children and the author of several books on pediatrics, died of a heart attack last Thursday at his home in Manhattan. He was 84 years old. Dr. Wilkes, who had a private practice in Manhattan and Queens, was a retired associate clinical professor of pediatrics at New York University Medical College and associate attending pediatrician at University Hospital.
